title: Set the Mood: Ayurvedic Aromas to Calm the Mind
author: Harish
excerpt: Sandalwood, vetiver, and tulsi form a calming aromatic trio perfect for meditation, grounding, and emotional clarity.
content:
Aromatherapy in Ayurveda

Ayurveda recognizes scent as a powerful tool for balancing the mind and nervous system. Natural incense blends use plant resins, roots, and leaves to create an atmosphere conducive to meditation and introspection.

Fragrance Profiles

  • Sandalwood: Cool, sweet, and grounding—supports focus.
  • Vetiver: Earthy and stabilizing—excellent for Vata balancing.
  • Tulsi: Purifying and uplifting—clears stagnant energy.

Using Incense for Meditation

  1. Light the incense until a steady ember forms.
  2. Place in a safe holder near your meditation space.
  3. Begin deep breathing as the aroma fills the air.
  4. Allow the scent to anchor attention and calm the senses.

Dosha Notes

Grounding blends like sandalwood–vetiver are great for Vata; tulsi helps uplift Kapha; sandalwood cools Pitta.
